page.title: 15BIOGRAPHY- MR. LEWIS WATKIN.
page.content: Mr. Lewis Watkin is a well known local personality who was born in l903 and has always lived in Pencoed. He left school when he was l3 years old and went to work in the village foundery. He worked a 48 hour week for the equivalent of 25p. He has always supported the scouts and he established the Observer Corps in Pencoed in l938 but they were originally called Special Constables. He still has his helmet. Pencoed has changed a great deal since Mr. Watkin was young but he prefers it as it is to-day with electric light, public sewers and a water supply to each house. Mr. Watkin was awarded the M.B.E. in l966 for services to sport and the Observer Corps. Mr. Watkin was the last blacksmith in Pencoed.
